critique: The document establishes a national voluntary action program within the executive branch to address domestic problems, particularly those related to urban living and poverty. It creates a Cabinet Committee on Voluntary Action, led by the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, to foster cooperation among government departments and promote voluntary activities. The order emphasizes the role of private organizations and individual citizens in contributing resources to solve public issues, supplementing government efforts. It also directs federal departments and agencies to support the program by providing information, assistance, and coordination. The document reflects a collaborative approach between the government and private sector to tackle social and economic challenges.
